result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel J. Downey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal 4th+), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Cash Bond previously posted in the amount of $250.00 has been applied.  The remaining balance of the Fine is to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges granted.
No DNA sample and/or surcharge is assessed as Defendant previously provided the same through another felony conviction under the alias last name of "Lucas".

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal 4th+)
charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel J. Downey

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 15CM-309 and 15CM-310 - Both Cases Called @ 2:58 PM: Defendant Daniel J. Downey in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Per SPD:  Def is prepared to resolve matters today.  ADA confirms resolution recited by SPD.  Def also concurs.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  15CM-309 Plea:  NC  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  15CM-310 DRI.   Argument by ADA.  Argument by SPD - states a total of 11 days already served prior to posting bond.  Statement by Def:  Yes, apologizes to Court.  The Court:  15CM-309 - imposes 20 days WCJ, Huber and GT, 11 days TS credit to be applied - Report 10/1/2015 at 8:00 PM; $694 Fine inclusive of costs - Bond to be Applied - 60 DTP or PP.  DNA Sample to be provided today; 6 mos DL Rev mandatory.  Appeal Rights Given.
BOND ORDERED AS TO BOTH WAUSHARA CO CASE NOS. 2015CM000309 and 2015CM000310.  No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license.

15CM-309 and 15CM-310 - Both Cases Called @ 1:38 PM: Defendant Daniel J. Downey in court, in custody, with attorney Ben Szilagyi, both appearig via video.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Per SPD - Eligibility confirmed.  DA argues for Cash Bond w/conditions as to both filed.  Also requests no contact provisions and states reasoning.  SPD argues as to bond - argues for Signature Bond as to both files.  The Court:  Single bond that applies to each case of $250 cash.   Counsel further discuss no contact provisions being requested.   IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Initial appearance scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
